title: Username with blanks incomplete in drawer #2361
body:
The username is too large to be shown completely in the navigation menu for any screen size. Space can be added after the trailing slash in the username.
This allows the username with multiple spaces to not be clipped at the position of last space.

title: Camera upload only works on specific path when folder is accessible in multiple ways
body:
When Camera Upload didn't work for me, I noticed that the same folder can be addressed through two different paths on my phone. I know both paths point to the same location because I see the same pictures in both. I don't understand this exactly, but I'm guessing one path is an alias or symlink to the other. I've waited the required 15+ minutes in both cases.

### Actual behaviour
- Camera upload does not work on a specific path, when two paths are possible to refer to the same folder

### Expected behaviour
- Download works for either path
 
### Steps to reproduce

1. Pick "Camera Folder" as `/sdcard/DCIM/Camera`
2. Take a picture A
3. Wait 20 minutes

No upload.

4. Pick "Camera Folder" as `/storage/6232-3632/DCIM/Camera`
5. Take a picture B
6. Wait 20 minutes

Upload of picture B. Picture A is still not uploaded.

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)

*Sorry, I didn't try this, because I can reproduce the behavior for the two paths, so I'm quite confident it's not about the server.*

### Environment data

Android version: 8.0.0

Device model: SM-J330F

Stock or customized system: stock

ownCloud app version: 2.10.0-beta-1

ownCloud server version: Debian, 10.1.0-1+1.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
Empty.

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
{"reqId":"bnZ4Oi4B4c3KudBLZv4S","level":3,"time":"2019-02-05T21:43:20+00:00","remoteAddr":"2001:a61:356b:cd01:1a5e:fff:fe97:a58b","user":"--","app":"PHP","method":"POST","url":"\/owncloud\/index.php","message":"mkdir(): Permission denied at \/var\/www\/owncloud\/lib\/private\/Setup.php#283"}
```
Huh? This has nothing to do with the issue, it's 21 days old.

#### Web server access log for step 1
Empty.

#### Web server access log for step 2
Shows access like:
```
2001:a61:356b:cd01:856:f1dc:1689:8e27 - miracle [27/Feb/2019:19:45:00 +0100] "GET /owncloud/ocs/v2.php/cloud/capabilities?format=json HTTP/1.1" 200 5915 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.10.0-beta.1"
2001:a61:356b:cd01:856:f1dc:1689:8e27 - miracle [27/Feb/2019:19:45:01 +0100] "GET /owncloud/ocs/v2.php/cloud/user?format=json HTTP/1.1" 200 950 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.10.0-beta.1"
2001:a61:356b:cd01:856:f1dc:1689:8e27 - miracle [27/Feb/2019:19:45:01 +0100] "PROPFIND /owncloud/remote.php/dav/files/miracle/ HTTP/1.1" 207 1101 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.10.0-beta.1"
2001:a61:356b:cd01:856:f1dc:1689:8e27 - miracle [27/Feb/2019:19:45:02 +0100] "GET /owncloud/index.php/avatar/miracle/256 HTTP/1.1" 200 859 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.10.0-beta.1"
2001:a61:356b:cd01:856:f1dc:1689:8e27 - miracle [27/Feb/2019:19:45:04 +0100] "PROPFIND /owncloud/remote.php/dav/files/miracle/ HTTP/1.1" 207 9601 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.10.0-beta.1"
2001:a61:356b:cd01:856:f1dc:1689:8e27 - miracle [27/Feb/2019:19:45:04 +0100] "GET /owncloud/ocs/v2.php/apps/files_sharing/api/v1/shares?path=%2F&reshares=true&subfiles=true HTTP/1.1" 200 3655 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.10.0-beta.1"
```

title: Owncloud application crashes when using FTP, SFTP or WebDav Ext.storage
body:
### Actual behaviour
The app was really good until I changed data sources. When setting your OC to use local filesystem (which is not recommended for security reason), this mobile app was perfect. When I've added NGINX webdav or Apache Webdav storage, the application crashes and is unusable. You click on 3-4 dirs and it crashes, my Samsung J7 closes the app. To the developers: Can you please replicate this issue & fix? 

### Expected behaviour
- Application must not crash
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Setup FTP, SFTP or WebDav External storage
2. Browse it via Web - OK
3. Browse it via OC Mobile application. - NOK
Mobile application crashes.

1. Remove all external storages
2. Enable Local storage inside config/config.php with 'files_external_allow_create_new_local' => 'true', param.
3. Attach external "Local storage"
4. Browse via Web - OK
5. Browse via OC Mobile application
Mobile application no longer crashes.

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? No, since Local storage option needs to be added into config.php file.
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)


### Environment data
Android version: 8.1.0

Device model: Samsung J7

Stock or customized system:
Stock

ownCloud app version:
ownCloud for Android 2.9.3

ownCloud server version:
ownCloud 10.0.10 (stable) 

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
N/A
```

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
{"reqId":"XGCA8tATP2lCDI79zevWSAAAAAk","level":3,"time":"February 10, 2019 19:52:19","remoteAddr":"10.10.10.2","user":"admin","app":"no app in context","method":"GET","url":"\/index.php\/apps\/files_external\/userglobalstorages\/4?testOnly=false","message":"Exception: {\"Exception\":\"Sabre\HTTP\ClientException\",\"Message\":\"Peer's Certificate issuer is not recognized.\",\"Code\":60,\"Trace\":\"
#0 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/composer/sabre/http/lib/Client.php(103): Sabre\HTTP\Client->doRequest(Object(Sabre\HTTP\Request))
#1 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/composer/sabre/dav/lib/DAV/Client.php(231): Sabre\HTTP\Client->send(Object(Sabre\HTTP\Request))
#2 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/private/Files/Storage/DAV.php(259): Sabre\DAV\Client->propFind('https://gdisk.b...', Array)
#3 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/private/Files/Storage/DAV.php(579): OC\Files\Storage\DAV->propfind('')
#4 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/private/Files/Storage/Common.php(440): OC\Files\Storage\DAV->stat('')
#5 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/private/Files/External/LegacyUtil.php(205): OC\Files\Storage\Common->test(false, false)
#6 /var/www/html/owncloud/apps/files_external/lib/Controller/StoragesController.php(254): OC\Files\External\LegacyUtil::getBackendStatus('\\OC\\Files\\Stora...', Array, false, false)
#7 /var/www/html/owncloud/apps/files_external/lib/Controller/UserGlobalStoragesController.php(121): OCA\Files_External\Controller\StoragesController->updateStorageStatus(Object(OC\Files\External\StorageConfig), false)
#8 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/private/AppFramework/Http/Dispatcher.php(153): OCA\Files_External\Controller\UserGlobalStoragesController->show(4, false)
#9 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/private/AppFramework/Http/Dispatcher.php(85): OC\AppFramework\Http\Dispatcher->executeController(Object(OCA\Files_External\Controller\UserGlobalStoragesController), 'show')
#10 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/private/AppFramework/App.php(100): OC\AppFramework\Http\Dispatcher->dispatch(Object(OCA\Files_External\Controller\UserGlobalStoragesController), 'show')
#11 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/private/AppFramework/Routing/RouteActionHandler.php(46): OC\AppFramework\App::main('OCA\\Files_Exter...', 'show', Object(OC\AppFramework\DependencyInjection\DIContainer), Array)
#12 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/private/Route/Router.php(342): OC\AppFramework\Routing\RouteActionHandler->__invoke(Array)
#13 /var/www/html/owncloud/lib/base.php(909): OC\Route\Router->match('/apps/files_ext...')
#14 /var/www/html/owncloud/index.php(54): OC::handleRequest()
#15 {main}\",\"File\":\"/var/www/html/owncloud/lib/composer/sabre/http/lib/Client.php\",\"Line\":356}"}
```

title: [Release] 2.10.0
body:
### TASKS
 - [x] [COORDINATION] Ping community guys to publish a blog post, at least one week before releasing.
 - [x] [GIT] Create branch release_2.10.0 in owncloud/android from master
 - [x] [GIT] Create branch release_1.0.0 in owncloud/android-library from master 
 - [x] [DEV] Update min version to 19 + remove Jelly Bean workaround
 - [x] [DEV] Update version number and name in build.gradle in android module
 - [x] [DEV] Update version number and name in build.gradle in oc_jb_workaround module 
 - [x] [DIS] Create changelog file (< 500 chars) and add to CHANGELOG.md in owncloud/android 
 - [x] [QA] Design Test plan @jesmrec
 - [X] [QA] Regression Test plan  @jesmrec
- [x] [DOC] Include new changelog on Releases section of github android repo by drafting the new release 2.10.0 
 - [x] [GIT] Create and sign tag oc-android-2.10.0 in HEAD commit of release branch, in owncloud/android 
 - [x] [GIT] Create and sign tag oc-android-library-1.0.0 in HEAD commit of release branch, in  #owncloud/android-library 
 - [x] [GIT] Merge branch release_1.0.0 in owncloud/android-library, into master
 - [x] [GIT] Merge branch release_2.10.0 in owncloud/android, into master 
 - [x] [DIS] Generate test APKs files from branch master in owncloud/android and perform some basic operations.
 - [x] [DIS] Generate final APK files from signed commit in owncloud/android
 - [x] [DIS] Upload & publish release APK and changelog in Play Store
 - [x] [DIS] Update screenshots and store listing, if needed, in Play Store
 - [x] [DIS] Remove OC JB workaround app from Play Store.
 - [X] [FEEDB] Creation of new specific mail addresses for feedback in  otrs mail @michaelstingl 
 - [x] [SPREADTHEWORD] Write a topic in central about the release. https://central.owncloud.org/t/owncloud-2-10-for-android-released/18900
 - [x] [COORDINATION] Write in corresponding channels.
 - [x] [COORDINATION] Write email to release-coordination mailing list.
 - [x] [SPREADTHEWORD] Write a post in the blog @lefherz 
 - [x] [DOC] Update documentation with the new features. @settermjd 
 - [x] Publish app in F-Droid [AUTOMATIC]
 - [x] [GIT] merge master branch into stable, in owncloud/android-library
 - [x] [GIT] merge master branch into stable, in owncloud/android

### BUGS & IMPROVEMENTS:
- [X] #2431 [DONE]
- [X] (1) Upload notification appears twice [FIXED] 
- [X] (2) Lack of notification when deletion is not allowed in shared folders https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2453#issuecomment-469754623  [FIXED] 
- [X] (3) Feedback channel changes [FIXED]

title: Include missing contributions and use proper versionCode in 2.10 beta 1
body: I forgot to include a couple of contributions and the versionCode was not the good one, since `21000100` should be used in the final 2.10.0 version. Can you review this quickly @jesmrec , @hosy, @abelgardep ?

title: Login fails with "§" in password
body:
### Actual behaviour
- We can login with a User

### Expected behaviour
-Login in with a User
 
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Set the Password of a User to QWERTZqwert123456!"§$%&
2. Login with App

### Error
Wrong User
We are using LDAP


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)

No only if the Password is QWERTZqwert123456!"§$%&


### Environment data
Android version:
8
Device model: 
All
Stock or customized system:
Stock Version
ownCloud app version:
2.9.3
ownCloud server version:
10.1.0

### PR

- App https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2542
- Library (if needed) https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/249

title: [New architecture] Create public shares
body:
Let's continue implementing the [new architecture](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2351)  with a new use case, **Create public shares for a file** , following the next architecture:

![owncloud android app architecture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/52778836-2c90a900-3047-11e9-8347-e96ce9e2e20d.png)

_____
### TASKS

- [x] Include insert share query in OCShareDao
- [x] Include insert share operation in OCLocalDataSource
- [x] Include insert share operation OCRemoteDataSource
- [x] Include insert share operation in OCShareRepository
- [x] Include insert share function in OCShareViewmodel.
- [x]  Connect PublicShareDialogFragment with OCShareViewmodel to insert shares.
- [x] Error handling, adapt ErrorMessageAdapter
- [x] Use room implementation in Content Provider to insert shares
- [x] Tests:
  - [x] OCLocalDataSource
  - [x] OCRemoteDataSource
  - [x] OCShareRepository
  - [x] OCShareViewModel
  - [x] UI tests

### PR
- App: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2461
- Library: https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/240

### QA

Checks performed after automatic tests: https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/240#issuecomment-479440004

title: Update local file path after download finishes(Issue #2422)
body: After file download finishes, the progress bar stays visible because the file was not updated in the file detail ui. I've updated the file in detail ui. Issue [https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2422](2422)

title: change 2018 to 2019 in comments
body:
In my point of view, the year is **obsolete**, but a lot of PR receive a review concerning this.
So I made this to move faster on each PR

title: remove useless log entries concerning wrong version
body:
It removes this useless log entries, it concern to beta-version. This entries were miss leading.
Now it writes out a **warning** only on wrong real versionCode

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3314607/52531814-b83ec880-2d1b-11e9-85c3-0cf62e98bbea.png)

title: remove Lint errors

title: Developer menu on version click
body:
1. The first click nothing happen
2. after you need 4 more clicks
3. now the developer menu appears (currently only log option)
4. further clicks point to github.com commit like before

You could use this switch for some other use cases too, but this is your decision (and your or additional PR)
Btw, I use it [here](https://github.com/hannesa2/owncloud-android/releases) to investigate why my [upload doesn't work](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2394) and [AndroidX](https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2402) should crash

title: Replace the ownCloud file picker with the Android one when uploading files
body:
We could replace our current file picker with the Android one based on [Storage Access Framework (SAF)](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/providers/document-provider), making simple for users to browse and upload documents, images, and other files.

This is what we currently have to upload files from the Android internal storage. 

| Tap upload button | Select  files | oC custom file picker |
| ------------- | ------------- | ------------- |
| ![device-2019-02-07-123248](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/52409101-c058f700-2ad4-11e9-9aa7-cc37b08f90fa.png) | ![device-2019-02-07-123317](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/52409104-c2bb5100-2ad4-11e9-8f7e-a268eca1e4a1.png) | ![device-2019-02-07-122748](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/52408884-3315a280-2ad4-11e9-94b4-d33e5e88c28e.png) | 

On the right we have our custom file picker, which has made sense for several years but **Android 4.4 (API level 19) introduced the storage access framework**, which makes the life easy to the Android developers, being the responsible of showing files to perform actions with them. 

Fortunately, we have this already when using the content from other apps button.

| Tap content from other apps button | Storage access framework |
| ------------- | ------------- | 
| ![device-2019-02-07-123659](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/52409380-a4a22080-2ad5-11e9-9b59-1b262ad57d0a.png) | ![device-2019-02-07-124014](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/52410059-8806e800-2ad7-11e9-8c88-1c35afaa9aa2.png) | 

As you can see above, in the screenshot on the right, we can upload files images, videos, recent, internal storage and other apps files from there so **our custom file picker would not be needed anymore and we would save time spent in fixing known and coming issues on it since Android picker takes care of that and also includes additional sorting, select all, search features and more.**

So this is what I propose:

1. Get rid of _Content from other apps_ button and our custom file picker implementation.
2. Use the already implemented SAF for _Content from other apps_ option in _Upload files_ option.

This would be the **UI result**:

| Tap upload button | Select  files | Storage access framework |
| ------------- | ------------- | ------------- |
| ![device-2019-02-07-123248](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/52409982-50983b80-2ad7-11e9-97ca-3cf918eb18c0.png) | ![device-2019-02-07-123317](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/52409104-c2bb5100-2ad4-11e9-8f7e-a268eca1e4a1.png) | ![device-2019-02-07-124014](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/52410059-8806e800-2ad7-11e9-8c88-1c35afaa9aa2.png) | 

What's your opinion on this? @hosy @michaelstingl @jesmrec 

### PRs
- App: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2479

title: Please add support for ownCloud 7/8 back into Version >=2.9.3
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Installed the most recent version of the client (due to OS update to Android 7 etc.) and now I cannot setup an account anymore. It throws an error "Fehlerhafte Server Konfiguration". My server uses an own certificate I have to confirm first once.

### Expected behaviour
- I should be able to setup my account and use the client. The server configuration has not been changed and it used to work before. Also DAVx5 connections for contacts and calendar still work.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Try to setup your account - while testing the connection it throws the error mentioned and refuses to continue

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? No
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)


### Environment data
Android version: Fairphone Open 18.10.0 (Android 7)

Device model: Fairphone 2

Stock or customized system: one of the stock systems

ownCloud app version: 2.9.3 (from fdroid)

ownCloud server version: 

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
Insert your ownCloud log here
```

title: Avoid NPE in RenameFileOperation on IOException
body:
If/when an IOException occurs during a `FileRenameOperation`, the `result` variable is guaranteed to be `null`. I don't think there's any more information to send to the logger when this happens.

This issue was flagged up by LGTM.com: https://lgtm.com/projects/g/owncloud/android/alerts/

There are a few other alerts for this repository (including a few more potential NPEs and resource leaks), but I'm not familiar enough with the code base to assess whether these issues should be addressed (and if so, how).

It's possible to have LGTM perform automated code review for every pull request; here's an example how Google's AMPHTML open source project use that to catch potential security vulnerabilities: https://github.com/ampproject/amphtml/pull/13060

There are some more alerts on other ownCloud projects that are worth a look. For example: a few [XSS vulnerabilities have been flagged up in the imagelib extension](https://lgtm.com/projects/g/owncloud/apps/alerts/) in `owncloud/apps`.

(full disclosure: I'm an active ownCloud user myself, an am also part of the team that built LGTM.com)

title: Upgrade min version (currently API 14 - Android 4.0)
body:
Currently, the min version supported by the app is 4.0:

https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/980d9c73a953e708a6798aa5dc0164a21897c17a/owncloudApp/build.gradle#L66

Android 4.0 (and older) are used by a residual amount of users:

https://developer.android.com/about/dashboards/

We can not forget that there are also some features not supported for such version, f.ex. the ones that take advantage of the Jobs (available from API 21).

Since Android 4.4 keeps ~7% , it is a possibility of `minSdkVersion`.  Other option is going directly to 5.0

Your ideas are welcome

title: Switch CI support to BitRise
body:
As currently is doing in the new iOS app, BitRise CI is a good tool to integrate with in the mobile world. It improves the performance like Travis, and will let us to have all the CI infra together under the same environment.

Since the new architecture components is going on (https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2403), will let us to develop more test and trigger them por push and pr, a step forward in the product quality.

- Check if it is posible to trigger against an specific branch
- Integrate to execute test
- Remove travis in arch branch (check if it is posible)

title: Unable to replace a new sync url(owncloud server address) on my phone
body:
### Actual behaviour
- I get owncloud client app from Google Play, the latest one,2.9.3 (2018.Nov updated)
before that, I created an owncloud server url monthes ago,it is a local network url. Just for testing some server feature.
Now, I would like to use an official server url/address to replace old one. 
It is failed. Now it shows the first page ("please type your server address________"),
and once I type the correct url, it will shows the error message "rename local fail msg"

### Expected behaviour
- I expected if the new server url is connected successfully, and app will show next pages to guide me type user name and password, and create new sync folder.
 
### Steps to reproduce
I am not sure the details steps to duplicate that. But I do remember, before that, there is a local network test url, it works fine, and I would like to replace new url in that sync pages(it has folders, account info, user name, server url info), but it seems failed that moment, so I tried to uninstall app and re-install app, clear caches etc. They didn't help on this. 


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
No, I can access that official owncloud server url via browser-webpage, and Mac OS app.
Only failed on Android app. (I didn't use WinOS and iOS clients)


### Environment data
Android version: Android 9.0

Device model: Mi - Mix 2S

Stock or customized system: MiUi 10

ownCloud app version: 2.9.3

ownCloud server version: 8.0.2

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
Insert your ownCloud log here
```

title: [Snyk] Fix for 1 vulnerable dependencies
body:
#### Description
This PR fixes one or more vulnerable packages in the `maven` dependencies of this project.
See the [Snyk test report](https://app.snyk.io/org/owncloud/test/github/b2264d27-4753-4343-be3f-a29326b3babd/master..snyk-fix-fv9ghx) for more details.

#### Snyk Project: [owncloud/android:automationTest/pom.xml](https://app.snyk.io/org/owncloud/project/b2264d27-4753-4343-be3f-a29326b3babd)
#### Snyk Organization: [owncloud](https://app.snyk.io/org/owncloud)


#### Changes included in this PR

- Changes to the following files to upgrade the vulnerable dependencies to a fixed version:
    - automationTest/pom.xml


#### Vulnerabilities that will be fixed
##### With an upgrade:
  - `automationTest/pom.xml`
      - `io.appium:java-client@5.0.0 > io.appium:java-client@7.0.0` 
          - [Deserialization of Untrusted Data](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-COMGOOGLEGUAVA-32236)
      - `org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-java@3.0.0 > org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-java@3.13.0` 
          - [Deserialization of Untrusted Data](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-COMGOOGLEGUAVA-32236)



You can read more about Snyk's upgrade and patch logic in [Snyk's documentation](https://snyk.io/docs/using-snyk/).

Check the changes in this PR to ensure they won't cause issues with your project.

Stay secure,
The Snyk team

_**Note**: You are seeing this because you or someone else with access to this repository has authorised Snyk to open Fix PRs. To review the settings for this Snyk project please go to the [project settings page](https://app.snyk.io/org/owncloud/project/b2264d27-4753-4343-be3f-a29326b3babd/settings)._

title: Travis deterministic release build
body:
With this line, I mentioned you don't use Travis to build release version
https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/415f88f79051aeb9d36f1fc4217ae65a8d2527f5/owncloudApp/build.gradle#L105

I would be nice to have a deterministic build chain.
This means :

- add a tag builds automatic a release version  
- uploaded to PlayStore Alpha
- in app you can see the Travis build with commit in preferences

In my fork https://github.com/hannesa2/owncloud-android/releases I already did this
- add a tag builds automatic a release version 
- upload to Github ~~uploaded to PlayStore Alpha~~ (I'm not interested to publish an additional Owncloud app)
- in app you can see the Travis build with commit in preferences

![owncloudtravis 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3314607/50536110-49355800-0b51-11e9-809c-8f8f6ff7e0b3.gif)


I can't make a complete PR because for preparation of Travis I've not the permission.  
Here you can have an inspiration:

- Signing release on Travis  https://github.com/hannesa2/owncloud-android/commit/08edaa39c02e2e7e6a913f11e94a3684b4bf4fa5
- Show CI build https://github.com/hannesa2/owncloud-android/commit/87095414f3fc8297e3879869b6950f272c17a60c
- Upload to PlayStore with https://github.com/Triple-T/gradle-play-publisher some preparation has to be done by someone with access to Playstore to require *.p12 file and get ServiceAccountEmail

eg 

```
    play {
        track = 'alpha'
        serviceAccountEmail = System.getenv("PLAY_SERVICE_MAIL")
        pk12File = file('../signing/GooglePlay.p12')
    }
```

I could help/assist if someone is interested in complete story

title: Google Camera effects broke camera upload feature
body: ### Actual behaviour While using the default Google Camera application on my Pixel 2, all normal taken pictures are considered by the Camera Uploads feature. But by using effekts like Portrait, Panorama, Burst mode, the images will not be synchronized to OwnCloud. I checked both on 415f88f79051aeb9d36f1fc4217ae65a8d2527f5, current [ownCloud 2.9.3](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.owncloud.android) and [Sciebo based on 2.8.0](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.sciebo.android) ### Expected behaviour Pictures taken by the default camera applikation should be synched, no matter if taken as Portrait or Panorama. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Use Google Camera application 2. Take a picture in Portrait, Panorama, Burst mode 3. wait synching time (or compile for debug purposes a lower sync time) for nothing to be uploaded / check the log for ignoring messages Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) I don't think, this is a server issue, more likely a client feature problem. ### Environment data Android version: 9 5.12.2018 Device model: walleye Pixel 2 Stock or customized system: both default ownCloud and Sciebo system ownCloud app version: 2.9.3 / 2.8.0 / 415f88f79051aeb9d36f1fc4217ae65a8d2527f5 ownCloud server version: can't check and doesn't matter ### Logs Can't provide any, sorry. ### Places to fix in [CameraUploadsSyncJobService.java#L124](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/owncloudApp/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/files/services/CameraUploadsSyncJobService.java#L124), all the files and folders correctly are gathered in an Array, sorted afterwards and then with the function `handleFile()` checked. The problem is, that the Google Camera application persists pictures taken in Portrait, Panorama etc. mode will be persisted into a folder with the familiar timestamp as name. Inside this folder there are at least one picturefile inside it. For example folders of portrait pictures usually contain a normal picture named "00000PORTRAIT_00000_BURST20180218135144728.jpg" and one with blurred background "00100dPORTRAIT_00100_BURST20180218135144728_COVER.jpg". Those pictures will be ignored, because the folder checked in `handleFile()` [CameraUploadsSyncJobService.java#L158-L171](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/owncloudApp/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/files/services/CameraUploadsSyncJobService.java#L158-L171) is neither a picture nor a video but `application/octed-stream` as mimeType. | Debug Log | localFiles[] content | mimeType| |---|---|---| ||||

title: [New architecture] Get public shares for a file
body:
**Get public shares for a file** is the first use case to start implementing #2351 , following the next architecture:

![1 1 get public shares for file](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/53404435-f7287b80-39b5-11e9-83bd-0ebd6aaf5aab.png)

Thanks to the `ViewModel` and `LiveData` , the shares shown in the view will be binded to the database, updating them automatically when a new change is detected. 

_____
### TASKS

- [x] Include needed dependencies: Kotlin, room, lifecycle, testing...
- [x] Create Share entity
- [x] Create ShareDAO with query to get public shares for a file 
- [x] Use LiveData in ShareDAO
- [x] Implement Room database 
- [x] Create ShareRepository
- [x] Create ShareViewModel 
- [x] Connect SharesFragment with ViewModel to retrieve automatically the public shares.
- [x] Observe shares and errors with livedata
- [x] Error handling 
- [x] Expose shares stored in room by using Content Provider.
- [x] Add additional state (LOADING) to show loading dialog. 
- [x] Database migration
- [x] Tests:
  - [x] ShareContentProvider
  - [x] OCLocalDataSource
  - [x] OCShareDAO
  - [x] OCRemoteDataSource
  - [x] OCShareRepository
  - [x] NetworkBoundResource
  - [x] OCShareViewModel
  - [x] UI tests

title: Android X (P)
body:
I was forced to use Android P as well, so it's the move to P as well
 
-----------

Edited by @davigonz

About **Android P**, I'm gathering some changes from [here](https://developer.android.com/about/versions/pie/android-9.0-changes-28) that might affect the ownCloud Android app when targeting Android P:

- **Network TLS enabled by default**: if your app targets Android 9 or higher, the isCleartextTrafficPermitted() method returns false by default. If your app needs to enable cleartext for specific domains, you must explicitly set cleartextTrafficPermitted to true for those domains in your app's Network Security Configuration. Reproducible and fix in https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2402#issuecomment-456881009

- **Foreground services:**  apps that target Android P or higher and use foreground services must request the FOREGROUND_SERVICE permission. E.g.: https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/owncloudApp/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/files/services/FileUploader.java#L306


CC @jesmrec @hannesa2 

___


BUGS & IMPROVEMENTS

- [x] (1) Camera uploads https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2402#issuecomment-460961991

body:
### Actual behaviour

- in some cases , when using thirdparty app to take pictures, the pictures will be saved in a different folder
### Expected behaviour
- it should be able to choose more than one folder for auto upload 

 
### Steps to reproduce
1.  enable auto upload
2. choose auto upload folder 


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
Yes

### Environment data
Android version:
8.1.0
Device model: 
Huawei Mate 10
Stock or customized system:
Stock
ownCloud app version:
2.9.3
ownCloud server version:
10.0

```

```

title: Repeated conflict report on my todo list file
body:
Summary: I have a todo list file called "pomorodo.md" and every time (or often) whenever the mobile app syncs, it reports a conflict on said file.

### Actual behaviour
Conflict report on "pomorodo.md".
When I tell it to keep both versions and diff them, they're both 100% identical.

### Expected behaviour
No conflict.
 
### Steps to reproduce
Not reproducible accurately, but here are things I did with the file which might or might not have created this situation:

1. Installed app "DroidVIM" as I wanted a text editor on Android 9 (and the old "vimtouch" is not compatible)
1. Mark "pomodoro.md" file as "available offline"
1. Wait for sync
1. Later on, open "pomorodo.md" with "DroidVIM"
1. DroidVIM is actually broken, it just drops to a shell. Not sure what it did with the app. Likely a bug in that app.
1. Kill DroidVIM and move on
1. Later on, modify "pomodoro.md" on another machine and let it sync with desktop client (my work machine)
1. Unlock mobile phone, it syncs automatically => conflict on this file
1. Resolve conflict and tell it to either keep server version or both, then move on
1. Continue working on file on work machine, let it sync
1. Unlock mobile phone, it syncs automatically => conflict on this file

### Other steps to reproduce
1. Add a text file as av.offline.
2. Use "open with" option with QuickEdit to edit the text and then use close + save to upload the file. 
3. Repeat the step 2 several times till seeing the conflict dialog. 
4. Save both copies in conflict dialog.

### Environment data
Android version: 9

Device model: Nokia 6.1 (2008)

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: observed with 2.9.2, still happening with 2.9.3

ownCloud server version: 10.0.10

### Logs
#### Web server error log
- [ ] TODO at the next opportunity

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
- [ ] TODO at the next opportunity

- [ ] TODO: try opening another file with DroidVIM as above and see if it will cause the same behavior

@davigonz @jesmrec How does the mobile app know there is a file that needs to be reuploaded when opened with an editor ? Is there some staging area ? I wonder whether my adventure with DroidVIM caused something to stay in a pending state which would make the OC app think there is something to upload ?

I haven't tried clearing the cache and data of the app. My intuition tells that if I reset the app from scratch the problem will be gone. I'll leave it be for now to give us a chance to debug.

Would be good to know more about technical details and where I can look on the device: how does the app know what to sync, see above question.

title: UI glitch in eye icon used to show/hide the password when sharing a file publicly
body: ### Actual behaviour The eye icon used to show/hide the password of a public link is almost not visible due to the white color used. This eye icon is the same resource that we use in the login view and it needs to be white, so changing the color here will not solve the problem, use new resource maybe? [](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/49168190-48818a00-f337-11e8-9b82-477bb388ddba.png) ### Expected behaviour Eye icon should appear in grey color. [](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/49168488-e2e1cd80-f337-11e8-8040-8d2bab4d668e.png) ### Steps to reproduce 1. Long press a file 2. Press share option 3. Create new public link 4. Toggle Password option Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? Yes (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) ### Environment data Android version: 7.0 Device model: Nexus 5 Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 2.9.3 ownCloud server version: 10.0.10

title: Release 2.9.3 stable
body: It needs https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/218

title: Fix/welcome wizard rotation
body:
-solved issue 2281 "Change orientation in Welcome wizard" #2331

-solved the issue when Welcome wizard disappeared after screen rotation
-tested both on a phone (Galaxy S8 Oreo, Nexus 4 Nougat) and a tablet (10´ Lenovo TAB) with a success
-moved hardcoded text "SKIP" of a button to strings.xml (so it can be translated)
-created both landscape and portrait layout of Welcome wizard (the original layout wasn´t showing the whole "SKIP" button in smaller screens in landscape mode, so weight of the LinearLayout was slightly modified)

title: [Snyk] Fix for 2 vulnerable dependencies
body:
#### Description
This PR fixes one or more vulnerable packages in the `maven` dependencies of this project.
See the [Snyk test report](https://app.snyk.io/org/owncloud/test/github/b2264d27-4753-4343-be3f-a29326b3babd/master..snyk-fix-nxfu6t) for more details.

#### Snyk Project: [owncloud/android:automationTest/pom.xml](https://app.snyk.io/org/owncloud/project/b2264d27-4753-4343-be3f-a29326b3babd)
#### Snyk Organization: [owncloud](https://app.snyk.io/org/owncloud)


#### Changes included in this PR

- Changes to the following files to upgrade the vulnerable dependencies to a fixed version:
    - automationTest/pom.xml


#### Vulnerabilities that will be fixed
##### With an upgrade:
  - `automationTest/pom.xml`
      - `org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-java@3.0.0 > org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-java@3.1.0` 
          - [Denial of Service (DoS)](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-IONETTY-30100)
          - [Information Disclosure](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-IONETTY-30430)



You can read more about Snyk's upgrade and patch logic in [Snyk's documentation](https://snyk.io/docs/using-snyk/).

Check the changes in this PR to ensure they won't cause issues with your project.

Stay secure,
The Snyk team

_**Note**: You are seeing this because you or someone else with access to this repository has authorised Snyk to open Fix PRs. To review the settings for this Snyk project please go to the [project settings page](https://app.snyk.io/org/owncloud/project/b2264d27-4753-4343-be3f-a29326b3babd/settings)._

[//]: # (snyk:metadata:{"type":"auto","packageManager":"maven","vulns":["SNYK-JAVA-IONETTY-30100","SNYK-JAVA-IONETTY-30430"],"patch":[],"upgrade":["SNYK-JAVA-IONETTY-30100","SNYK-JAVA-IONETTY-30430"],"isBreakingChange":false,"env":"prod"})

title: After update no files are shown
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
In the "Alle Dateien" (All files) Tab, no files are shown, and the message "Alles leer. Laden Sie etwas hoch!" (All empty. Upload something!) is shown. I can upload files, but after reopening the app, the file also disappears (But is uploaded succesfully, as can be verified on other platforms).

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
All my files should be shown and accessible, like in Version 2.9.1.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Update from Version 2.9.1 to 2.9.2 (Or completely wipe the app)
2. Open app and update account.

###Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
No.

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Motorola G4

Stock or customized system: LineageOS 14.1

ownCloud app version: 2.9.2

ownCloud server version: sciebo 10.0.10

title: "Folder doesn't exist anymore" on OwnCloud account with a @ character
body:
### Actual behaviour
- The message described in the title appears when browsing in the app logged with an account with @ in the username.

### Expected behaviour
- Browse files should work normally.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create an account with a @ in the username, for example user@name
2. Log in on the ownCloud app for Android with that account.

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Nexus 6P

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 2.9.1

ownCloud server version: 10.0.10

### Logs
#### Web server error log
- No lines are appearing when the error occurs.

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
- No lines are appearing when the error occurs.

title: [2.9.3] New release with usernames containing @ hotfix
body:
### TASKS
 - [x] [GIT] Create branch `release_2.9.3` in owncloud/android from master
 - [x] [GIT] Create branch `release_0.9.24` in owncloud/android-library from master 
 - [x] [DEV] Update version code and name in build.gradle in android module
 - [x] [DIS] Create changelog file (< 500 chars) and add to CHANGELOG.md in owncloud/android
 - [x] [WIZARD] Show wizard when upgrading to 2.9.3
 - [x] [QA] Design Test plan @jesmrec
 - [x] [QA] Regression Test plan  @jesmrec 
 - [x] [GIT] Merge branch `release_0.9.24` in owncloud/android-library, into master
 - [x] [GIT] Merge branch `release_2.9.3` in owncloud/android, into master 
 - [x] [DIS] Generate test APKs files from branch master in owncloud/android and perform some basic operations.
 - [x] [GIT] Create and sign tag `oc-android-2.9.3` in HEAD commit of master branch, in owncloud/android 
 - [x] [GIT] Create and sign tag `oc-android-library-0.9.24` in HEAD commit of master branch, in  #owncloud/android-library 
- [x] [DOC] Include new changelog on Releases section of github android repo by drafting the new release 2.9.3
 - [x] [DIS] Upload & publish release APK and changelog in Play Store
 - [x] [SPREADTHEWORD] Write a topic in central about the release. https://central.owncloud.org/t/owncloud-2-9-3-for-android-with-fixes-for-usernames-containing-character/
 - [x] [COORDINATION] Write in corresponding channels.
 - [x] [SPREADTHEWORD] Write a post in the blog or spread the word via twitter @lefherz 
 - [x] [GIT] merge master branch into stable, in owncloud/android-library
 - [x] [GIT] merge master branch into stable, in owncloud/android

_____
